title: New effort seeks to study health issues for private astronauts
summary: Medical researchers and commercial spaceflight advocates are working to begin a new effort to study the health issues and risks that space travel poses to a more diverse population of private astronauts.

title: ESA Astronaut Aboard Space Station Controls Robot on Earth
summary:
ESA project astronaut Marcus Wandt successfully completed a series of tests for the Surface Avatar project that included controlling Bert, a four-legged robot developed by DLR. The Surface Avatar project was launched in 2020 and is being run by the German space agency DLR in partnership with ESA. The project aims to develop technology that […]
The post ESA Astronaut Aboard Space Station Controls Robot on Earth appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Rocket Report: Iran reaches orbit; Chinese firm achieves impressive landing test

title: Zeno to recycle decades-old radioactive material to fuel its radioisotope power systems
summary: Zeno Power Systems is partnering with the U.S. Department of Energy to recycle decades-old radioactive material to produce radioisotope power sources.

title: Northrop charges on lunar Gateway module program reach $100 million
summary: Northrop Grumman has taken another charge on its contract to build a module for NASA’s lunar Gateway, bringing its losses for the year on that program to $100 million.
